COMMENT_TX: Overflow crowd on field Niehaus's ML debut
Cuyler received great applause when he stepped to the plate
Niehaus's 1st ML AB; was given even a greater reception
Former Pirate Grimm applauded as he came to bat
Ground rule triple into RCF crowd
Ground rule triple into LF crowd
Kaufmann was becoming disgusted with the umpire's decisions
Smith tossed his bat at Ump Pfirman's feet
Ground rule triple into LCF crowd
Squeeze play; Barnhart easily doubled off 3B
The ball eluded Heathcote when he dove for it. During this AB, Hartnett was shaken up when he collided with the grandstand chasing Pie's foul fly, but stayed in game.
The ball bounced off Kaufmann's shoulder
Ground rule triple into LCF crowd
Ground rule triple into crowd near RF foul line
Ground rule triple over Miller's head and into LF crowd
Niehaus fumbled then threw wide to Kremer on 1B
Bush slipped while fielding it; Harnett muffed his throw as Barnhart crashed into him, and it rolled away.
On the pitch before the walk, Grimm was hit squarely in the pants but Ump Sweeney said he didn't try to dodge the ball.
Moore was fooled by the wind-blown ball.
Over Carey to the CF fence
Over RCF fence PGT: Miller drove the ball higher and farther over the RF fence than had previously been recorded by any hitter who swings from the right side of the plate.
Bounced off Koupal's shins into foul territory behind 3B.  He was hurt but stayed in the game>
ej,grimc101,P,odayh101,Call at 1B Grimm ejected by Ump O'Day for disputing the decision
Barnhart had trouble getting to it
Backhanded circus stop, but throw home was late
Soft liner over 2B got away from Wright
BOUNCE HR; it hit the foul line and bounced into LF bleachers
Grimm fell reaching for the wild peg by McAuley but held on while tagging the base at the same time.  Fans applauded.
Shoestring attempt by Zitzmann turned an ordinary single into HR when it got by him and rolled to LF fence.
Cuyler failed twice to bunt before looking at strike 3
Pretty 1-handed catch by Niehaus of Traynor's high throw
Diving stop but Niehaus couldn't hold the hurried low throw.
Fine stop; Moore tried for DP but was too late
Fine burst of speed by Carey after making turn at 2B
Douthit threw to 2B thinking Cuyler would not try to score
Hornsby swung and missed with count of 3-and-1. Off Traynor's glove but was almost nailed at 1B by Pie.
Nice stop on bounder over Yde
Moore couldn't hold onto the hard bounder
Wright tried to get out of the way of the pitch.  Bottomley knocked it down then dove for the bag to beat Wright.
Unassisted triple play.  With hit & run on, Wright was already moving towards 2B; he caught the liner a few steps from the bag, stepped on 2B then tagged Hornsby near 2B.
Griffith made a mighty effort at a catch
Fiery liner twisted and dipped past the lunging Heathcote to the flagpole.  Cuyler scored standing up.
Traynor raced home when the throw went to 2B.  McAuley's throw to get him was wide, but Hartnett recovered and threw to Jones.

CDT reported that Carey's 1st two steals were the fault of Stueland, but Hartnett was the goat in the double steal. Gabby held the ball until Moore was almost to 2B then made a foolish peg.  Carey didn't even slide.
Muffed foul after a fast run
Barnhart received an ovation as he came to bat; the crowd wanted his daily hit.
Barnhart was cheered again as he came to bat
Fast play; Grantham hurt his leg running to the bag
Over RF wall, into the new stands
Hartnett tossed the ball back to the box as if there were 3 outs; Blake retrieved it in time to hold the runners.
Over RF wall in front of the new stands
Singled after failing twice to sacrifice
Wright scored when Blades overthrew O'Farrell
Nice stop but threw high/wide to 1B
Smith was taken ill and had to retire
Tagged out by Smith; Cards protested it was foul
Dropped it after a long run
Remarkable running catch robbed Bottomley of extra-base hit
Brilliant stop but Dyer safe at home
Threw to 2B lying on the ground
Yde knocked down hot liner; Grantham then made a bare-handed catch of his wide throw.
Line crashed off Sothoron into CF
Schmidt waited for the ball to roll foul
Off Traynor's glove after Cooney had failed to sacrifice
Ground rule triple into LF crowd
Ground rule triple into LCF crowd
Ground rule triple into RF crowd; Cuyler turned over the ropes and into the crowd trying to get to it.
Traynor overthrew Barnhart who was covering 3B.
Ground rule triple into RF crowd
To LF crowd, but must not have gone past ropes
Blades went into the crowd to catch the ball
Ground rule triple into RF crowd
Through Fonseca and rolled into RCF pocket.  He scored without a slide.
During this AB Wright drove over LF wall but foul by inches

PDL: 'sneaked a hit through the especially-prepared defense the Pirates use for him.'

Stuffy's Pirate debut at the plate
Through McInnis' legs, but Moore backed him up; close play
Plucked it off LF stands concrete before crashing into it
Over the temporary fence which fronts the new RF stands

Before the game the Pirates played 3 innings vs a team of 1901 Pirate old-Timers featuring Honus Wagner, Ginger Beaumont, Tommy Leach, Fred Clarke, Kitty Bransfield, Claude Ritchey, Chief Zimmer, Jack Chesbro, Deacon Phillippe, Jesse Tannehill, Jimmy Burke, and Tom McCreery (from '00 club). Old-Timers 'lost', 4-3.
ej,fleta101,M,wilsf901,Balls and strikes Mgr Fletcher ejected for disputing Ump Wilson's decisions
Great running catch near flagpole saved HR
To the flagpole on the hit & run
Pie's throw drew Grantham off the bag
SBH while Graham was winding up; SB3 while Gibson held ball
Traynor started the attempted double steal but Moore was boxed between 3B & home.  Guessing assists from box scores.
Tagged out by Grantham on a quick play
Welsh played it safe; his throw home was cut off by Graham who had Cuyler trapped but he held onto it too long.
Off Traynor's knees; he threw late to 1B, Grantham making a good catch of the low throw.
Wright juggled DP ball long enough to allow the run to score
Moore knocked down the wicked liner with a high leap
Bigbee had hit a long liner to RF just foul; he then protested 3rd strike.
Hit the wall and bounded around
DWS: no CS on error in 1925
Welsh failed to sacrifice, then flied out
Infield hit; Stuffy hurt his foot crossing the bag
Would've been a double but Moore sprung a charleyhorse in his left leg and limped to 1B.
Diving circus stop, then jumped up to tag out Welsh
Took the foul off the stands
Thrilling stop; he tagged Padgett before throwing to 1B but Padgett just jumped back safely to 3B on a close play.
While a play was being made on Marriott (who overran 2B) Felix broke for home and was run down.
Traynor broke it down, saving a double
Fine stop; brilliant try for a play at the plate
Padgett was hit in the head and knocked unconscious by a bad hop, but was revived and remained in the game.
The overthrow landed in the stands
PGT: Welsh let it get away from him; BG: wild throw
Nice running catch near the flagstaff

NYEW: Jackson knocked down the smash headed for LF and Carey was run down between 3B & home.  Rawlings was out trying to get back to 2B, while Cuyler was out returning to 1B. Great action picture of this triple play in PGT.
Into the lower tier of the new RF stands
Running catch; Carey surprised Southworth whose late hurried throw went past Gowdy.
The breeze carried it over Barnhart to the scoreboard
The smash glanced off Aldridge's shins
Running catch by Meusel; daring base running by Carey caught Meusel by surprise.
Knocked down the smash; close play at 1B
Nice catch off his knees on the dead run
Texas Leaguer fell safe at Southworth's feet

Wayland Dean was painfully hurt pitching batting practice. A line drive from Southworth struck him on the left knee and when he fell his left ankle buckled under him.  He had to be assisted from the field.
Thrilling bare-handed stop of the carom off Meadows' glove
Hartley's throw to Groh had Cuyler boxed but it was low and Cuyler beat the return at the plate on a close play.  It was scored a double steal.
Fast assist; spectacular bit of fielding
Groh was only able to limp to 2B on the long hit to deep RCF

Cleared the RCF fence close to the former location of the scoreboard.  It just missed the farthest end of the new stands falling gracefully and without interference into the shrubbery of that verdant section. One of the longest homers ever struck in Oakland. NYT: the ball rolled far down into Panther Hollow in Schenley Park.
Meadows failed to cover 1B. During the AB, Carey failed on a sacrifice bunt attempt.
Grounded through spot vacated by Kelly on hit & run.  Fine relay by Kelly.  Very close play.
Ordinary single skidded past Youngs; Pie tried to score when Kelly momentarily juggled the relay.
Looked like an extra base hit

Close play at 3B; Farrell took Kelly's relay and was spiked on the right wrist (or elbow) as Moore slid into him.  Game delayed while he was being treated, but then had to retire. Great photo in PGT showed the slide/tag.
NYT: 'Groh had to limp back to his old job at 3B'
Close play; Barnhart toppled Groh and words were exchanged. Great photo in PGT showed Groh off the bag, a step toward 2B forcing Barnhart to start his slide early.

ej,grang102,P,mccob104,HBP (Threw bat) Hit in the back, inflicting a painful wound. Grantham was enraged, heaved the bat at Scott, then started for the box.  Scott came in to meet him but were separated by Groh and Mgr McKechnie (coaching 3B).  Benches emptied, most of the players gathering halfway up the 1B line. Grantham was ejected by Ump McCormick and later drew a $50 fine but no suspension. PGT headline: 'Shades of Fred Clarke and Kid Gleason'
Thrilling catch; Southworth had to gallop a city block
Ens dove into the bag on a close play
To the flagpole. Great PGT photo showed Cuyler sliding into home needlessly as the relay throw was so high Snyder threw his glove at it.
Hit & run; Meusel threw wide to the plate
High fly to short RF eluded Kelly for a scratch double
Cuyler made a nervy effort at a catch of the near HR
Spectacular assist by Kelly over 2B after it caromed off McQuillan's glove.
Diving, circus stop; threw to 2B while on the ground
With a 3-2 count, the supply of baseballs gave out; game held up for 10 minutes until more could be procured. Carey came in fast but muffed the liner after a hard run.
Nehf lost the bunt pop in the sun but Snyder recovered
Into RF stands near foul pole; high trajectory
Off the scoreboard; great relay by Wright
During this AB, Loftus was hit on the hand by a slow pitch but Ump McLaughlin ruled he didn't try to evade it.
After stepping on 1B Fournier fired to the plate wide
Sensational running catch robbed him of a potential HR
Traynor dropped the liner but stepped on 3B $RAIN DELAY of 14 minutes here

Brilliant effort to force Bigbee at 3B
Cuyler argued the called 3rd strike (low curve)
Stole as Meadows made ready to pitch
Nervy try by Wheat who crashed into the fence as the ball hit off the wall just over his glove.
Pitchout: Smith stepped over, swung, and dropped it over 3B
Sensational bare-handed grab; flipped to Stock at 2B on a very close play.  The entire Brooklyn infield gathered around Ump McLaughlin like infuriated hornets
Ran down terrific liner; Barnhart had to hurry back to 1B
$Over the wall at the edge of the new RF stands. Pittsburgh Press: landed on top of temporary fence in front of new grandstand in deep RF and bounded out of the lot.
Saved a bid for extra bases
Adams thought it had gone over the wall and stopped running
Caromed off LF wall with such force that it rolled to a point where Ford retrieved it; Carey was close to 3B by then and beat Ford's throw home. $Carey hit for the cycle.
Brown tried for 1-handed catch but couldn't hold it
Hit & run; fine scoop by Niehaus of Critz' low throw
Fans cheered Niehaus as he came to bat
Grounder hit Caveney in the face; game delayed
Attempted double steal; Ump Sweeney had to separate Roush and Smith who yearned to whale on each other.
Brilliant assist after snaring the hard smash
Whirlwind stop that looked like a double
Cuyler's astonishing throw nearly nailed Roush at 3B
Niehaus cut off Bressler's throw and threw low past 2B
Pretty catch near the stands PDT coverage ended here
Bigbee almost climbed the fence to rob Caveney
Tried to advance on Carey's momentary fumble
Wide throw pulled Niehaus off the bag
At the end of the game, Reds coach Grover Land and a spectator exchanged punches near the Red dugout.  Police broke it up.
Zitzmann failed in his bunt attempts before hitting into DP
Before the pickoff, Aldridge bunted past Bressler as he came charging in but the ball rolled foul just before the bag.
Wonderful play; sensational assist from behind 2B
PGT: Bad hop over Zitzmann.  PDT: Zitzmann played it badly

PDT: Aldridge suddenly dropped unconscious and doctors were called.  He had fainted.  He is said to be subject to these spells. PGT: Aldridge cut his hand on a piece of glass when he went to the dugout after pitching in the 4th.  Vic started to rub some stuff off the bench before sitting down; broken glass was among the dirt and it tore an ugly gash in his hand.
Hot liner caromed off Adams to Traynor who made a brilliant assist.
Hargrave started for 3B after the catch.  Wright cut off the throw and tried to nail Pinelli advancing to 2B, but his throw to Moore was wide.
Hit & run; play at 2B was close but Moore juggled it
PGT/PP: Yde deflected the line drive
Stole while pitcher held the ball
Clean theft of home, easily beating the pitch
Barnhart couldn't hold onto it when he crashed into the fence after a hard run.  Roush had to hold up.
Spectacular 1-handed stop of mean skimmer over 2B and great off-balance throw.  Good stretch by Grantham.
Moore was caught off 2B but got back safely
Cuyler threw over Gooch and into Reds dugout
Attempted double steal; Pinelli was boxed and run down.
Between Roush and Walker to the scoreboard
Cuyler's throw might have headed off Pinelli but it was cut off and relayed home by McInnis too late.
Flack fell as he caught the ball
After failing to sacrifice, he hit into GDP
Carey muffed the ball after a near collision with Cuyler
Shinners missed a 1-handed catch in front of the temporary fence.
Infield was in; fluke double likely would've been caught by Hornsby had he been playing his normal position. Flack made a desperate 1-handed stab at it.
SB while Rhem stood on the mound
Close play at home on attempted double steal
Good stop but Carey beat him to the bag
Fumbled easy chance; it rolled into CF
2 runs scored on a very wild pitch

Remarkable catch down the line by Wright with his back to the plate.  He wheeled around and made a perfect throw home. McInnis, who had rushed over from 1B, took the throw, and tagged Toporcer ten feet in front of Gooch.  (There's a great picture of the putout in PGT.)
Robbed of a hit; brilliant play on both ends
Over RCF barrier; landed between the temporary wooden fence and the new wall.
Should've been DP but there was a mixup at 2B and the throw was late.
Thrilling 1-handed stop and beat him to the bag
Hornsby's return throw was low 3 SBs by Cuyler in the inning
Earlier in the AB Shinners made a pretty bunt that rolled fouled just before reaching 3B.
Pretty stop behind 2B. Barnhart overran 3B thinking the ball went through.
Hit in the head but was able to stay in the game.
Spectacular diving stop of hard smash over 2B
Double steal while Smith held ball on mound; Smith made a play for Moore at 3B.

Between innings roommates Cuyler & Gooch got into a scuffle on the bench and had to be separated by Clarke, McKechnie, and Ump Wilson.  Cuyler, it is said by those who were close by, made a wise crack about the type of pitch Gooch called for on the Harris HR.  Gooch came back with his crack and they went at it.  They shook hands after the game.
Time was called to revive Carey
Benton stole 2B while Smith threw back to Meadows
Hit & run; looked like a sure Texas Leaguer.  Marvelous running catch by Wright who made a spectacular off-balance throw to 1B.  Good stretch and 1-handed catch by McInnis.

From Chilly Doyle's column in the 7/29/1925 Gazette-Times: 'Meadows showed the fans he could fan from either side. Batting left-handed he whiffed three times in the teeth of Benton's twists.  Marquard breezed Lee as the Pirate swung from the opposite side.'
Harris lost high fly in the sun
It rolled into the BSN dugout
Off Barnhart's glove trying for a shoestring catch
Great throw from deep RF.  BSN Mgr Bancroft protested that the ball had rolled under the canvas infield cover that lay rolled up in RF, and that a ground rule double should've been called.
Over Cuyler; would've cleared the fence that was taken down recently.
nice block of the plate by Smith.
Attempted double play but Barnhart safe at 2B
Hit the LCF fence under the scoreboard
DWS: no CS on error in 1925
During this AB, Smith drove the ball into the upper deck of the new stands but it curved foul.
Thrilling assist behind 2B robbed Cuyler who disputed call at 1B.
Skidded past Leach as he came dashing in
Cuyler's throw was ahead of the runner but it bounded high to Gooch who could not get the tag down in time.
Remarkable running back-handed, over-the-shoulder catch before crashing into the fence.  One of the greatest catches ever seen.
During this AB Gooch failed on Harper's foul near home plate but was not charged with an error.
Over the fence and into Schenley Park
During this AB Cuyler hit a liner just foul to RF
Moore tried to steal while Ring held the ball
Traynor's hand was spiked and ripped open yesterday during an exhibition game in Akron.  The painful lacerated wound was dressed and wrapped, but he had great difficulty throwing and holding a bat.
Sensational diving stop by Pie; his short throw was scooped by Grantham in astounding fashion.
Took it off the edge of the stands
Bigbee failed twice to sacrifice prior to force
Chased it nearly to the RF line
Eluded Wright for a scratch hit to CF
Cuyler's smash struck Mitchell and caromed to Friberg; Mitchell's hand was hurt but he stayed in the game.

During this AB Moore ran all the way to 2B missing a D7/7L by inches and had to return to batter's box.
Wild pitch was up and in to Carey
Fournier cut off throw home then threw high to 2B

ej,grimb101,P,pfirc901,Fighting ej,carem101,P,pfirc901,Fighting $the liner caromed off Burleigh Grimes' leg to the 3B stands near the Brooklyn bench; Jimmy Johnston retrieved the ball and ran towards 3B; Max Carey rounded 2B and returned but Johnston threw to Grimes who limped towards 2B in pursuit of George Grantham heading to that bag; when Carey started for 3B, Grimes threw to Johnny Mitchell who was between Carey and 3B; as Mitchell ran after Carey, Carey turned and shoved Grimes who was standing in the base path; Grimes took a swing at Carey; both benches cleared; Grimes was called for obstruction; Grimes and Carey ejected by HP umpire Cy Pfirman
Taylor failed to bunt twice before K
Cox got a glove on it but couldn't hold on
Ford came up with a lame right leg
Mitchell went to 2B on the throw and 3B on the error
Attempted double steal; Hargreaves bluffed throw to 2B
Sensational stop & throw NYTEM reference copy was cut off from here to end
Thrilling catch falling into BRO dugout after the catch
Taylor had advanced to 3B after the catch but was called out by Ump Pfirman when BRO threw to 2B claiming he left early.
Attempted double steal; very close play at plate
Brown did not field it cleanly; runners took advantage
Hit & run single through the vacated hole
Attempted steal while BRO attempted an intentional pass.
Attempted double steal NYTEM coverage ended here

During this AB Stock hit a liner down RF line; Cuyler crashed into the wall as he missed it.  It looked fair but Ump Hart called Stock back to bat.  The decision caused a wild scene around the plate; 10-minute delay. Hart claimed he called time before the pitch.
Great throw by Kiki; brilliant scoop by Pie
Great running, 1-handed circus catch close to the flagpole
Close play. $Smith's spikes ripped the left leg of Kelly's trousers to shreds so the game was delayed while repairs were made in the dugout.
Called out on what looked like a very bad strike. $When the Giants came to bat, it became dark; thunder was rumbling and lightning was flashing.
2-2 count when the storm broke; NYTEM coverage ended here

$Terry was at bat when time was called by Ump Quigley. Rain delay of 1:31; play was resumed at 5:47pm as the sun came out. A squad of groundskeeper's assistants went to work with brooms, pails, sponges, and sand and dried up the infield, though there was a miniature lake near the RF stand. The game was completed on a mushy, dangerous field.
Youngs slid head first and came up looking a sight
Ump Quigley called the ball foul but was overruled by Moran
Meusel's slipping and sloshing in the wet grass aided both doubles.
Well hit but was slowed down by the wet grass. Grantham slipped rounding 1B; close play at 2B.
Fine catch of Pie's high throw
NTEM coverage ended here--continued on p.12 (unavailable)
Wide throw but called out; Pirates disputed the decision.
Grantham made a good try for it but only slowed it up
$Terry's high fly fell between Wright and Barnhart
Hit & run grounder through the vacancy left by Kelly; Youngs fumbled for the briefest instant.
Carey's speed stretched an ordinary single into a double
Meusel threw to 2B instead of home. $Straw hats flew onto the field as the score was tied.
Kelly juggled, then lost it among his feet
Missed a homer by a foot
$Light rain began falling as the Giants went to bat
SB on pickoff throw by Barnes
Close play; Barnhart was spiked on the foot by Snyder

$NYEW: Meusel rounded 3B and stopped short halfway to home. Kelly rounded 2B and approached 3B; both runners were hung up.  Kelly knocked the ball out of Traynor's hand. Kelly and Traynor each took a swing at the other; Ump O'Day got between them and restored peace; as the flareup had been mutual and no damage had been done both players were allowed to remain in the game. PGT: Meusel stopped at 3B but Kelly ran him off.  Carey threw to Moore who sent the ball to Gooch boxing Meusel who was tagged out by Traynor.  Pie then threw to Wright and Kelly was boxed.  Pie tagged him out but Kelly knocked the ball out of his hand.  Traynor turned as if to strike Kelly and a scene of general excitement ensued.
Relay throw to 1B was low, else DP
With Yde at bat Ump Moran stopped the game due to the rain. Rain was still falling when play resumed after a 15-minute delay.
Attempted double steal; Terry covered the plate
Wide throw. It started raining again.
Hit & run; Kelly started to cover 2B but was able to get back and make a fine 1-handed stop.

Aldridge held it too long, then threw a little high and wide left, arriving about the same time as the sliding Frisch. Smith dropped it and was charged with the error but it was mostly Aldridge's fault.
Southworth injured his left hand diving for it; the game was held up for a few minutes, but he continued.

$1-1 count to Jackson when a heavy shower made Ump Moran call time.  Play resumed after 20-minute delay with PH Webb at bat.  Jackson injured his knee batting just before time was called and was unable to complete his turn at bat.
During Frisch's AB, Traynor lost a catchable pop foul near the stands due to the sun.
Cuyler overslid 3B NY Times: 'Kiki hit the mud and simply kept on sliding'
Cuyler singled on hit & run after fouling off a bunt attempt
Stretched a single to a double
Meadows deflected it again; fine assist by Wright
Smith lost it in the sun and it bounded away
Wide throw to 2B; Gooch's hand was spiked by Smith's slide
Pinelli tried to force Carey at 2B.  Carey hurt his leg in sliding; time was called while first aid was given.
Hit & run; unassisted DP by Walker
During this AB, Gooch misjudged a foul pop but no error
Zitzmann thought Gooch would throw to 1B and ran into an out
Morrison deflected it.  During this AB, Traynor failed in a desperate try for a foul near the plate.

Took a high bad hop over Critz into RCF; barehand stop by Walker held Moore.

High throw to 1B; close play at home, but Rawlings hurdled O'Farrell.

ej,felig101,P,morac102,Fighting ej,smite106,P,morac102,Fighting Felix' spikes cut Smith's left arm as they collided at the plate.  Smith jumped on Felix while the latter was still on the ground.  The umpires and players acted quickly to prevent an extended battle, though Smith got the better of it.  Both players were ejected; Braves protested Felix'.
Cuyler nearly made a spectacular catch of Smith's ball near the stands but it got away from him.
